title: How to Clean a Washer and Dryer

steps.title: Get rid of mold and mildew odors, as well as a built up of soap and fabric residue by running the machine empty with hot water and about 2 cups of white vinegar.
steps.content: Get rid of mold and mildew odors, as well as a built up of soap and fabric residue by running the machine empty with hot water and about 2 cups of white vinegar. (You can use 1 cup of bleach instead of vinegar, but bleach can damage the rubber gaskets). [1] X Research source [2] X Expert Source Chris Willatt House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 1 July 2019.

steps.title: Run a cycle of hot water and 1 gallon (3.8 L) of white vinegar if you have hard water once a month or every 10 loads.
steps.content: Run a cycle of hot water and 1 gallon (3.8 L) of white vinegar if you have hard water once a month or every 10 loads. The vinegar will help to dissolve the mineral deposits caused by hard water or well water.

steps.title: Clean the top of the lid and underneath the lid of the washer with a damp sponge.
steps.content: Clean the top of the lid and underneath the lid of the washer with a damp sponge. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pull out the lint trap (if your machine has one) and rinse it under running water.
steps.content: Pull out the lint trap (if your machine has one) and rinse it under running water.

steps.title: Clean out the soap, bleach and fabric softener dispensers.
steps.content: Clean out the soap, bleach and fabric softener dispensers. If these cups are removable, take them out and rinse them under running water. Otherwise, use a pipe cleaner or some cotton swabs to remove the residue. (If you do this after each load, they won't get an accumulated build-up of gunk and grime). [4] X Research source

steps.title: Clean the lint filter thoroughly.
steps.content: Clean the lint filter thoroughly. Use the narrow wand attachment on your vacuum cleaner to remove as much lint as possible that has built up underneath the filer itself. If you don't have a vacuum, insert a duster into the filter well and wipe up the lint. [5] X Expert Source Chris Willatt House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 1 July 2019. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Vacuum or wipe down the interior of the dryer, including the door seal.
steps.content: Vacuum or wipe down the interior of the dryer, including the door seal. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Detach the dryer lint duct and clean it out, or vacuum it out.
steps.content: Detach the dryer lint duct and clean it out, or vacuum it out.

steps.title: Check the outside vent.
steps.content: Check the outside vent. Lift the flap and make sure there isn't any debris or lint blocking the vent, preventing air from escaping freely. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Wash down the top and the exterior of the dryer.
steps.content: Wash down the top and the exterior of the dryer. Use warm, sudsy water and then rinse the soap residue off. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Remove melted crayon, ink or dyes by applying an all-purpose spray cleaner on the drum and wipe it up with a damp cloth or paper towel.
steps.content: Remove melted crayon, ink or dyes by applying an all-purpose spray cleaner on the drum and wipe it up with a damp cloth or paper towel. [10] X Research source For extra measure, toss a few old towels into the dryer and run it on the high setting for about 20 minutesâ€”any color residue not removed with the spray cleaner will transfer to your old towels.
